title: Potential due to components of electric field

content.question: The numeric components of the electric field in a region of space can be calculated using the equations <math alttext="E sub x equals 6 x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E sub y equals negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions yields the potential difference between the points <math alttext="0 comma Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>Y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="X comma Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>X</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>Y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 X squared Y, minus 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>Y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
